memberdef.name: eepr_state
memberdef.initializer: = { .RSR.u8 = 0xFF, .hwprotection = 0, .protectionstartadd = 1, .protectionendadd = 0, .state = EEPR_DISABLED, .stateend = EEPR_DISABLED, .statestart = EEPR_DISABLED, .statereq = EEPR_NO_REQUEST, .substate = 0, .triggerentry = 0, .repeat = 2, .timer = 0, .eepromaddress1 = 0, .eepromaddress2 = 0, .currentpagelength = 0, .nr_of_pages = 1, .readtime = EEPR_READTIME_PER_PAGE, .writetime = EEPR_WRITETIME_PER_PAGE, .page_nr = 0, .write_len = EEPR_PageLength, .read_len = EEPR_PageLength, .ramaddress = 0, .currentchannel = EEPR_CH_HEADER, }

briefdescription.para: transition function for error states
EEPROM state is reset to state after initialization.
checks if the transition from one state to another one is allowed

parameterdescription.para: eepr_channel to be written or read from

simplesect.para: the requested state if accepted or EEPR_STATEREQFAILED if denied

briefdescription.para: updates the current state after checking once again if the transition is allowed and sets all the variables needed
sends error message and clears the error event

detaileddescription.para: Clears the error event and sends an errormessage.

briefdescription.para: initialization of external Serial EEPROM device (AT25128N)

simplesect.para: DIAG_EEPR_OK if initialization OK, otherwise DIAG_EEPR_ERROR

briefdescription.para: calculates the maximum writetime for a specific channel
calculates the maximum readtime for a specific channel
max. time for reading of eeprom data of the current channel
max. time for writing of eeprom data of the current channel
calculates the maximum rest readtime for the current channel, by substracting the readtime taken to read the current amount of pages
calculates the maximum rest writetime for the current channel, by substracting the writetime taken to read the current amount of pages
control of EEPROM Data management
reads "byte_len" of bytes from EEPROM memory starting at "address" and saving data in "byteptr"

parameterdescription.para: starting address of EEPROM where to read data
length of bytes that are to be read

briefdescription.para: writes the protection bytes BP0 and BP1 into EEPROM
sets the startaddress and the endaddress of the hardware-protected area
returns actual state of EEPROM state machine
requests a state change to be handled by eeprom state machine (used by external modules)

detaileddescription.para: requests a state to be handled by the statetrigger

parameterdescription.para: eeprom channel to be written or read from
source (destination) RAM address (buffer) for writing (reading) from eeprom

simplesect.para: 0 if request was accepted, 1 if eeprom is busy, 2 if request was denied

briefdescription.para: cyclic trigger of EEPROM State Machine, trigger cycle: 1ms trigger timer in units of 1ms
Driver for the storage in the EEPROM memory.

07.10.2015 (date of creation) Module-prefix
EEPR driver for external EEPROM device AT25128 (16kByte) /HOLD and /WP are permanently kept at Hi-Level, thus HW-Write-Protection (WP) is disabled. SW-Protection(Block Write Protection) could be done by Sending Command EEPR_CMD_WREN if disabled before by EEPR_CMD_WRDI. At startup the device is unprotected. Actual state will be provided by EEPR_CMD_RDSR (Read Status Register). A Block Write Protection can be controlled by Status Register Bit BP1 and BP0 in different address ranges within the whole range: Byte Address 0x0000..0x3FFF
Protected Address
BP1
BP0
None
0

0x3000..0x3FFFF
